thread.title: Balls of DNA Could Fix Geothermal Energy’s Biggest Problem
thread.title_full: Balls of DNA Could Fix Geothermal Energy’s Biggest Problem

title: Balls of DNA Could Fix Geothermal Energy’s Biggest Problem
text:
23 Balls of DNA Could Fix Geothermal Energy’s Biggest Problem 
Wired: Geothermal power has the potential to be cheap, reliable, and abundant—running off the heat of the Earth 24 hours a day, seven days a week. That’s especially true thanks to a new generation of home-grown geothermal plants, which don’t run off the steam of natural hot springs and geysers. No need to find those hydrothermal gems; today, geothermal engineers are making their own reservoirs by drilling down into hot rock and pumping in water.
